newsitem.title: FRANCE: Reuters French Advertising & Media Digest-July 18.
newsitem.headline: Reuters French Advertising & Media Digest-July 18.

text.p: News from Reuters and the French press on Advertising, Marketing, Media, the Internet and Brand-name Products.

PARIS - The marriage Ouest-France/TV Magazine creates a mix with the biggest print run of the French press at 6.16 million copies. TV Magazine leads its market segment among men aged 25-49 and is read by 6.41 million women, more than women's weekly Femme Actuelle. (Le Figaro)
PARIS - France Television, grouping public French TV channels France 2 and France 3, has asked the government for more money for 1998. (Liberation, Le Figaro, Les Echos, La Tribune)

PARIS - Dobermann, a film co-produced by public French TV channel France 3 which has been showing in France, Switzerland and Belgium since June 18, will not be shown on France 3 because it is too violent. (Liberation)

PARIS - French luxury goods group LVMH will have to pay British merger partners Guinness and Grand Metropolitan Plc a premium if it wants a drinks merger in which it would be the leading shareholder with 35 percent, analysts say (Reuter)

PARIS - Orangina France, which has won prizes for its advertising campaigns for its famous fizzy orange drink, is to apply its golden touch to Ricqles, a fizzy mint drink its parent, Pernod Ricard, bought from Perrier last year and which has not run a campaign for five years. (Le Figaro)

PARIS - France was the biggest tourist destination in 1996 with 62.4 million foreign visitors, but the tourist industry's turnover has not kept pace, running third behind the U.S. and Spain. (Le Parisien)
